message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you the chance to purchase this product. Given its incredible potential, I'm asking for $1,100,000. I believe this is a fair price that reflects the immense value it will bring to your business.
I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $950,000. I believe this is a more reasonable price considering the product's value to me.

Bob, I appreciate your counter-offer, but $950,000 is a bit too low for me. This product offers significant value, and I'm confident it will exceed your expectations. How about we meet in the middle at $1,025,000?

I understand your perspective, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to meet you halfway from my original offer, so I'll counter with $975,000. I believe this is a fair compromise.

Bob, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate.  While $975,000 is closer to what I had in mind, I can't quite let it go for that price. How about we split the difference between our last two offers and settle at $1,000,000 even? This reflects the true value of the product.

I understand your persistence, but I'm still not convinced that $1,000,000 is a fair price. I'm willing to compromise further, so I'll counter with $990,000. I think this is the highest I can go without sacrificing too much of my budget.
